SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Easily Specify a Landing Page for Customer Service Representatives (CSRs)

Optimize your organization's workflow for a customer service representative (CSR) that logs in to your storefront on behalf of a buyer. You can now specify which Visualforce page a CSR navigates to after they log in.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, a CSR always navigated to your storefront's Visualforce Home page after they logged in.

This enhancement provides the following benefits:

Fewer clicks for the CSR to access the storefront features that you want them to use, such as results for a specific category on the Product List page.
A fallback destination for links from your Visualforce pages to an Experience Builder site page, which doesn't support CSR workflow. When your storefront's home page is an Experience Builder site page, a CSR is redirected to this Visualforce page instead.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the Home Page module in your storefront configuration settings includes the new CSR Redirect Page configuration. The value for this configuration is the namespaced Visualforce page that you want a CSR to navigate or fall back to. Include any required page parameters, such as categoryId for the Product List page category results. To specify a custom subscriber page instead of a default Visualforce page, include the c__ prefix, such as c__customCSRLandingPage.

NOTE Ensure that the permission set assigned to your CSR users includes access to the Visualforce page that you specify.

title: Configure Customer Service Representative (CSR) Redirect Page in B2B Commerce for Visualforce
